comments.text:

comments.author: 502waf

comments.text:
well all I can say is that in wild the one who act strong becomes king. 
Even a calf could be king if it survives attack. A kid bear can become king 
if it defeats leopard or any big cat. So definition of king is not

comments.author: ankushzap

comments.text:
All animals are like that, but that's because there is no place for 
misplaced bravado in the wild, just a slight injury in the wilds of Africa 
is a death sentence with the likelihood of infection and any injury  that 
slows the animal down will mean it starving to death. They can't take a 
trip to the ER to get patched up like Humans, who despite our supposed 
superior intelligence, are the only animals that are stupid and prideful 
enough to think that losing face and pretending we aren't scared is a 
positive trait.
comments.author: 502waf

sure hope you don't eat meat. Oh, and by the way, 
plants/fungus/protists/bacteria are living too, and their goal in life is 
to not get killed but to pass on their DNA and make more organisms. So, any 
time you eat a mushroom, get a bacteria related sickness and have your 
immune system kill it, or step on an ant, you are killing something that 
did not want you to kill it. And BTW, I don't think that lion would want 
you to kill it.
